definition: to have second thoughts about sth/to think better of
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: Turn to peruse a to think, ego for the sake of this face depart the Rui surname river's mountain regardless of?
sentences.chinese: 轉念一想，難道自己爲了這顏面就棄睿氏江山不顧？

sentences.english: It initially rejected their application, but changed its mind.
sentences.chinese: 一開始此項目申請被拒絕，不過後來轉念通過。

sentences.english: He took his knife and fork, and was going to commence eating, when the inclination appeared to become suddenly extinct.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起他的刀叉，正要開始喫，忽然又轉念了。

sentences.english: Could he have Colonel Fitzwilliam in his thoughts?
sentences.chinese: 難道他在替費茨威廉上校轉念頭嗎？

sentences.english: At first, she wanted to call the guards, but on second thoughts she changed her mind.
sentences.chinese: 起先，她想叫衛兵，但是一轉念又改變了主意。

sentences.english: But other days, I took it in stride.
sentences.chinese: 但是我轉念一想，就能泰然處之。

sentences.english: Then I turned my thoughts to consider wisdom, and also madness and folly.
sentences.chinese: 我轉念觀看智慧，狂妄和愚昧。

sentences.english: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.
sentences.chinese: 我又轉念，見日光之下有一件虛空的事。

definition: to console
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
money for a voyage/travel expenses
to twine/to coil
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
not in good condition/wrong/fishy
to write off at one stroke
residual heat/surplus heat/fig. old people's capacity for work
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
to keep silent
to work to no avail (idiom)
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to be secretly delighted
